item.title: 019. Counting Sundays
item.description: Problem Statement You are given the following information, but you may prefer to do some research for yourself: 1 Jan 1900 was a Monday. Thirty days has September, April, June and November. All the rest have thirty-one, Saving February alone, Which has twenty-eight, rain or shine. And on leap years, twenty-nine. A leap year occurs on any year evenly divisible by 4, but not on a century unless it is divisible by 400.
